required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Magnetic Activated Cell Sorting in Artificial Insemination With Donor Sperm
clinical_study.official_title: Application of Magnetic Activated Cell Sorting (MACS) of Spermatozoa in Artificial Insemination Cycles With Donor Sperm (AID)

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to analyse the efficacy of MACS technique for the selection of spermatozoa and its effects on implantation, pregnancy and miscarriage rate. This study will be performed by two IVI clinics (IVI Sevilla and IVI Madrid) with the purpose of finding new techniques that allow us to better select spermatozoa and improve the results of assisted reproduction techniques.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Ultrasound examination is performed 5 weeks after artificial insemination. Pregnancy rate is calculated during the phase of data analysis.
primary_outcome.description: The number of pregnancies confirmed by ultrasound divided by the number of artificial insemination cycles. Pregnancy is confirmed by ultrasound examination.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The beta hCG analysis is performed 15 days after artificial insemination. Implantation rate is calculated during the phase of data analysis.
primary_outcome.description: The number of positive results of beta human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG) test divided by the number of artificial insemination cycles. Implantation is confirmed through the analysis of beta hCG in blood.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Live births are assessed at delivery (end of pregnancy period). Live birth rate is calculated during the phase of data analysis
primary_outcome.description: The number of live births divided by the number of artificial insemination cycles

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This parameter is assessed when preparing the sample for artificial insemination (one hour before artificial insemination).
secondary_outcome.description: Concentration of sperm cells in sperm sample before and after applying the MACS technique

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This parameter is assessed when preparing the sample for artificial insemination (one hour before artificial insemination).
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of sperm cells with progressive motility (according to World Health Organisation 2010 criteria) before and after applying the MACS technique

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This parameter is assessed when preparing the sample for artificial insemination (one hour before artificial insemination).
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of sperm cells with normal morphology (according to World Health Organisation 2010 criteria) before and after applying the MACS technique

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This parameter is assessed when preparing the sample for artificial insemination (one hour before artificial insemination).
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of live sperm cells before and after applying the MACS technique

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This parameter is assessed when preparing the sample for artificial insemination (one hour before artificial insemination).
secondary_outcome.description: The volume of sperm obtained after masturbation

arm_group.arm_group_label: MACS is applied to the sperm sample
arm_group.description: Previous to the AID technique, the sperm sample undergoes capacitation through Percoll density gradient and MACS

arm_group.arm_group_label: MACS is not applied to the sperm sample
arm_group.description: Previous to the AID technique, MACS only undergoes capacitation through Percoll density gradient, but not MACS technique

intervention.description: MACS is a technique that allow us to tag and detect apoptotic spermatozoa. These apoptotic spermatozoa have phosphatidylserine in their membranes, so we add magnetic beads with Annexin V, which binds specifically to phosphatidylserine. The spermatozoa are then tagged and can be retained in a magnetic field, allowing us to collect just the non-apoptotic spermatozoa.
intervention.arm_group_label: MACS is applied to the sperm sample

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women who undergo artificial insemination with donor sperm
- Signing an informed consent form to participate in the study
